questions.prompt: Which country is the only one with coastlines on both the Caspian Sea and the Persian Gulf?
questions.explanation: Iran borders the Caspian Sea to the north and the Persian Gulf to the south.

questions.prompt: What is the southernmost national capital city in the world by latitude?
questions.explanation: Wellington, New Zealand, is the southernmost capital city in the world.

questions.prompt: What is the northernmost capital city of a sovereign state by latitude?
questions.explanation: Reykjavík (Iceland) is the northernmost capital of a sovereign state.

questions.prompt: Which city is the highest administrative capital city in the world (by elevation)?
questions.explanation: La Paz, Bolivia, is widely cited as the highest administrative capital city.

questions.prompt: Which country has the most time zones when overseas territories are included?
questions.explanation: France spans the most time zones due to its overseas territories.

questions.prompt: What is the southernmost point of mainland Africa?
questions.explanation: Cape Agulhas is Africa’s southernmost point; Cape of Good Hope is a common misconception.

questions.prompt: What is the world’s largest lake by surface area?
questions.explanation: The Caspian Sea is conventionally considered the largest lake by surface area.

questions.prompt: Which lake is the deepest in the world?
questions.explanation: Lake Baikal in Russia is the deepest lake on Earth.

questions.prompt: What is the largest island in the world (excluding continents)?
questions.explanation: Greenland is the world’s largest island when continents are excluded.

questions.prompt: Which delta is commonly cited as the largest river delta in the world?
questions.explanation: The Ganges–Brahmaputra (Bengal) Delta is widely described as the world’s largest river delta.

questions.prompt: Which named sea is the only one without a land boundary (bounded by ocean currents instead)?
questions.explanation: The Sargasso Sea is defined by the North Atlantic gyre currents and has no coastline.

questions.prompt: Which river is the longest in Europe?
questions.explanation: The Volga is Europe’s longest river.

questions.prompt: Which river is the longest in Asia?
questions.explanation: The Yangtze is the longest river in Asia.

questions.prompt: Which mountain is usually classified as the highest peak in Europe (Caucasus definition)?
questions.explanation: Under the common Caucasus boundary, Mount Elbrus is Europe’s highest peak.

questions.prompt: Which is the highest mountain in Africa?
questions.explanation: Kilimanjaro is Africa’s highest mountain.

questions.prompt: What is the highest mountain in Antarctica?
questions.explanation: Vinson Massif is the highest peak in Antarctica.

questions.prompt: What is the longest mountain range above sea level on Earth?
questions.explanation: The Andes form the longest continental (above-water) mountain range.

questions.prompt: Which is the largest desert on Earth by area?
questions.explanation: Antarctica is classified as a desert due to very low precipitation, making it the largest by area.

questions.prompt: What is the largest peninsula in the world by area?
questions.explanation: The Arabian Peninsula is the largest peninsula by area.

questions.prompt: Which is the largest bay in the world by area?
questions.explanation: The Bay of Bengal is typically cited as the world’s largest bay by area.

questions.prompt: Which strait connects the Red Sea to the Gulf of Aden?
questions.explanation: Bab el-Mandeb is the gateway between the Red Sea and the Gulf of Aden.

questions.prompt: Which strait forms part of the border between Denmark and Sweden?
questions.explanation: Øresund separates Zealand (Denmark) from Scania (Sweden).

questions.prompt: Which strait separates Asia from North America?
questions.explanation: The Bering Strait lies between Russia and Alaska.

questions.prompt: Which narrow passage connects the Atlantic Ocean to the Mediterranean Sea?
questions.explanation: The Strait of Gibraltar is the opening between the Atlantic and the Mediterranean.

questions.prompt: Which lake is often called the world’s highest navigable lake (to large vessels)?
questions.explanation: Lake Titicaca (Peru–Bolivia) is widely cited as the highest navigable lake.

questions.prompt: Which glacier is commonly cited as the longest glacier outside Earth’s polar regions?
questions.explanation: Fedchenko Glacier in Tajikistan is widely described as the longest glacier outside the polar regions.

questions.prompt: What is the largest salt flat in the world?
questions.explanation: Salar de Uyuni (Bolivia) is the world’s largest salt flat.

questions.prompt: Which waterfall is the world’s tallest uninterrupted waterfall?
questions.explanation: Angel Falls in Venezuela is the tallest uninterrupted waterfall.

questions.prompt: The lowest land-based elevation on Earth is found at the shores of which body of water?
questions.explanation: The Dead Sea’s shoreline is the lowest land-based elevation on Earth.

questions.prompt: Which river passes through or along the borders of 10 countries from Germany to the Black Sea?
questions.explanation: The Danube is famous for flowing through or touching 10 countries.

questions.prompt: Which mainland African country has the longest coastline?
questions.explanation: Somalia has the longest coastline on mainland Africa.

questions.prompt: Which country is widely cited as having the world’s longest coastline?
questions.explanation: Canada is commonly listed as the country with the longest coastline.

questions.prompt: France’s longest land border is with which country (via an overseas department)?
questions.explanation: France shares a long border with Brazil via French Guiana.

questions.prompt: What is the highest point in the European part of the Netherlands?
questions.explanation: Vaalserberg is the highest point in mainland (European) Netherlands.

questions.prompt: Which lake is the largest freshwater lake in the world by surface area?
questions.explanation: Lake Superior is the largest freshwater lake by surface area.

questions.prompt: Which is the largest island in the Mediterranean Sea?
questions.explanation: Sicily is the largest island in the Mediterranean.

questions.prompt: Which country is completely surrounded by South Africa?
questions.explanation: Lesotho is an enclave entirely surrounded by South Africa.

questions.prompt: Which country is the only landlocked nation in Southeast Asia?
questions.explanation: Laos is the only landlocked country in Southeast Asia.

questions.prompt: Which lake is the world’s largest (by surface area) located entirely within one country?
questions.explanation: Lake Michigan is the largest lake by area wholly within a single country (the United States).

questions.prompt: Which two countries share the world’s longest international border by total length?
questions.explanation: The Canada–United States border is the longest international border in the world by total length.
